body.name: maxsun AMD Radeon RX 580 8GB 2048SP GDDR5 Computer Video Graphics Card GPU for PC Gaming 256-Bit DirectX 12 DVI, HDMI, DisplayPort Multi Monitors Extend (Black)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 15 hrs 43 mins
features: The Radeon RX 580 2048SP is a graphics card by AMD. Built on the 14 nm process, and based on the Polaris 20 graphics processor, in its Polaris 20 XL variant, the GPU supports DirectX 12. This ensures that all modern games will run on AMD Radeon RX 580 2048SP.
Metal backplate installed reducing the risk of graphics card deformation.
5 full digital video output, HDMI+3*DP+DVI for multi monitors extend.
Support DirectX 12, Vulkan, Shader Model 5.0, OpenGL 4.6/4.5, 4K Video Decode & Encode

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.3 4.3 out of 5 stars 137 ratings 4.3 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Excellent Cooling A large area of copper is covered on the aluminum radiator with 4*6mm heat pipes and 9CM PWM dual fans to provide an excellent cooling effect for the GPU works at a lower temperature, higher efficiency & stability. PowerOC PCB & Quality Materials MAXSUN AMD Radeon RX 580 2048SP graphics card has a silver plated PowerOC PCB & all solid capacitors, independent MOS heat sink, and high-quality GPU memory chipset ready for harsh working even in harsh terms. Metal Backplate The pre-installation metal backplate reduces the risk of graphics card deformation and improves cooling ability. AMD FreeSync & Multi Screes The full digital output can maximum extend 5 monitors in 8K resolution, with AMD FreeSync technology putting an end to choppy gameplay and broken frames with fluid, artifact-free performance at virtually any framerate. Behold the next breakthrough in PC and console gaming experiences.
Powerful AMD's Polaris 20 XL series architecture, smoothing HD gaming and beyond.
VR Ready, Incredible VR and Beyond HD Gaming Experiences

Specification Graphics Card Model AMD Redon RX 580 GPU Core Code Polaris 20 XL GPU Core Processes 14nm Stream Processors (CUAD) 2048 GPU Core Clock 1168~1284MHz Video Memory Clock 7000MHz Video Memory Size 8GB GDDR5 Video Memory Interface Width 256bit Video Memory Bandwidth 224GB/s Bus Interface Type PCI Express X16 3.0 Standard Display Connectors HDMI+3*DP+DVI Maximum Digital Resolution 8K (7680x4320) Pixel DisplayPort Supplementary Power Connectors 8 pins TDP 150W Recommended System Power (W) 350W 3D API DirectX 12, Shader Model 5.0, OpenGL 4.5/4.6, Vulkan

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Choice for Budget Builds
reviews.reviewText: Runs most games at medium to high settings at a playable frame rate. The card is definitely beginning to shows it's age, but it's the best price for any budget card ATM.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great budget GPU for 60FPS gaming
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a Maxsun RX 580 8GB 2048SP to test and review.In regards to connectivity, Maxsun’s RX 580 2048SP has three DisplayPorts, an HDMI port, and a VGA plugin. This allows users to easily connect multiple monitors at high refresh rates.Not to be confused with the standard RX 580 8GB, the 2048SP model has fewer shading units and a lower GPU clock, putting it slightly below the standard 580 8G in performance.This AIB features a dual-fan cooler that’s largely made of plastic and feels very cheap. That’s par for the course when buying a graphics cards of this caliber, and doesn’t necessarily mean it’s a bad buy.During testing, the cooler actually performed rather well. At stock settings, the GPU rarely exceeded 65 degrees, even when running at maximum load for extended periods of time.In titles such as Fortnite, VALORANT, and CS:GO it can easily handle 144FPS gaming, and it’s not bad for 60FPS in many AAA games, especially if you dial down the graphics a little bit. All things considered, for the cost, Maxsun’s RX 580 2048SP isn’t a bad choice if you’re looking to put a solid GPU in your budget gaming PC.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great and very quiet but an older design.
reviews.reviewText: This graphics card works very well for a lot of games but is not powerful enough for 4K gaming. That being said, I like the card because I play a lot of retro games that don't require the latest and greatest graphics card and it works well for them all. I had Grand Theft Auto V working very well although I had to reduce the graphics quality to medium to make it work right.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Its a LEGIT RX580! But
reviews.reviewText: This is my first OFFICIAL GPU for my recent sleeper build, and honestly, I was skeptical about the quality of this card as it was a Chinese GPU. I bit the dust and bought the card anyway as vanilla visa cards are now blocked by Amazon's competitors so I couldn't get a used GPU for cheap. The price is a bit higher compared to the Chinese platform market, but regardless, this card does the job at a good brand new price. Wish they had the option to ship the GPU in a box.... And yes it comes up as a legit RX580 8gig

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent value for money!
reviews.reviewText: • Excellent value for money in modern gaming• Excellent 1080p Performance , Capable of 1440p at cost of FPS• Vulkan compatible and will run all the Emulators such as YUZU, Ryujinx, Cemu, Dolphin, PSPP, Etc. I was able to get fullspeed emulation on native resolution on Zelda, Mario and many more.• Can Overclock (OC) in Afterburner and card stays cool for long play tests• Base idle sounds is below 8 db and max fan speed is not noisy• Most games can run over 60fps depending on quality settings. Check out my videos and I show some of the settings, of course you can adjust to your liking.• Competitive games running ins 1080p like Overwatch and LOL , maintain a low latency and can be adjust to over 160fps.• I am extremely pleased with the cost to performance of this GPU and its ability to stay relevant in modern games. Even if certain heavy titles like cyberpunk don’t run high fps its still smooth and very playable. At this price its cheaper than any game console and will maintain its value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Overheats, bad graphics
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace a black nvidia 1060 card as I was doing an all white build. Item arrived and it appears to be used. Lots of scratches and when I booted computer up it would not even recognize it as an amd card. Attempted to use card and it would overheat and shut down. Very dissatisfied with the card.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: does a good job, easy to install

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing budget GPU for 1080p Gaming
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I've been using this GPU for about a few weeks now and so far, it's working very well. I'm getting over 100 FPS in games like Fortnite, apex legends, and Valorant. Furmark gave it a score of 4283. Keep in mind this is a 1080p card so it will struggle at 1440p or 4K gaming. Definitely would recommend as a budget card on a mid to low end gaming setup. Also make sure to keep in mind this is a 2048SP version so it has less stream processors than the original RX 580 so the performance won't be as good, but it can still handle most games.

I just bought this card for my old AMD FX build to extend its life. I own some of the more recent versions of the builds like one based on 3900 series (3900X) and another on 5900 series (5950X) and I use both AMD and NVidia cards. What I am frustrated about is that something like AMD FX still has plenty of power and potential in it; it's 8 core CPU with still OK cache. I never had issues playing games or developing software or even virtualizing with it. Lately I am disappointed with Windows, let's face it - after Windows 7 all the other versions ended up being complete crap! Windows 11 now requires TPM module, my Asus TUF 990FX R2.0 has the slot of it but I don't want to order that card. I just figured I'd put Linux Mint Debian Edition on it instead of Windows. System has 32 gigs of RAM and I also setup 4 TB RAID 5 and put SSD as a main drive. This computer flies! now! It boots up super quickly, entire Linux Mint install is clean and it only took me 1 day to load all of my additional software on it like JetBrains IDEs - full pack, Steam, Games, etc... I had HD7950 in it at first with 3 gigs of VRAM but it was obviously not enough to use PROTON for my type of games. So I ordered this card. RX580 I think is like the last card you can probably load into system such as mine with 8 gigs of VRAM but it's worth it for the price that seller offers it for! I just got my card today and I already installed it and the first thing I did is I ran Steam and PROTON layer to test how it all worked. With 7950 I did not have enough VRAM to run games but with 8 Gigs of VRAM now I do! This RX580 is relatively compact in comparison to the one I loaded into my wife's PC. Aorus RX580 is much bigger than this card, also the voltage connector on this card is the 6 pin one and not 8 so just another awesome addition I think. First thing I checked is Battlezone 98 Redux and Battlezone II and guys these Windows games ran just friggin fine on full settings with PROTON layer on Mint! in fact, I think they looks even prettier on Linux than on WIndows! I have them on both types of machines but they look great on Linux! Huge thanks to Valve and Steam and Mint team for developing such an outstanding software! Love you guys, you all made my day! Before I move on to things like FarCry 5 and 6 I am loading FarCry 3 right now which is about 11 gigs of download from Steam. I can't wait to see what this card would do and how it'll handle it! So far, I believe, I've made the right choice here by purchasing this GPU from this vendor. If you want freedom from Windows OS and don't want to spend an arm and the leg on the GPU (I did that I got my 3090 during COVID times because I really needed that type of GPU for work but the price was C.R.A.Z.Y! No GPU should EVER cost that much money because guess what?! 6 Months later, not even that, it'll be obsolete or not current. I'm also avoiding 4000 series from NVidia because they are not well designed.) anyway, where was I; and you want to play relatively new games and you need to make sure that you have at least 8 GB VRAM this is the GPU that you would want! This seller delivered the card on time and so far with no issues. My only note was that I did not notice any protective tape on the GPU box itself so I was not sure if it was a brand new card. Only protective tape I found was inside the box on the bag that was housing the card itself. It seemed that all looked new but I can't ever tell. Either way I have a GPU that works with 8 GB of VRAM and it was delivered to me quickly. I'd buy this again from the same seller. If I'll have any issues in the future I'll post additional notes but so far everything is looking well and good! If you are in the same situation where you just don't want to throw your old, still capable system out and want to repurpose it then this GPU might be for you and, honestly, you should see how quick the system is running Mint and games play well too with high settings! I do development and .NET 8 and Python and lots of other stuff and all works well! I'll be testing more games on this system later but the product was made for this type of situation! Very happy with my purchase and service provided by this seller!

Cabe destacar que estás tarjetas son las RX 570 Americanas cambiadas en el BIOS por AMD para China.La quise poner en crossfire con una XFX RX 480 y no funcionó. Pero de hecho corre el Crysis Remasterizado mejor que la RX 480, Aunque al 100% de uso de la GPU.

reviews.reviewText: Onesta, cannonata per giochi fino 2022, validissima anche per titoli recenti, scatola cinese, forse ex miner ma comunque pare ottima.

reviews.reviewText: Really please with this pc . Easy to use a d set up . Great for playing emulators on and retro games . Excellent customer support service. Great price and quick delivery.
